poem:
Skate Park Summer

In the whirr of silence,   
the skateboard whispers,  
crisp as pages torn   
from the book of sky.  
Australia rests, bans aglow,  
shelved screens breathe,   
each wheel-turn a word,   
spinning tales of freedom.  
Tech's grip loosens,  
summer unfolds,  
a young boy's dance,  
in concrete poems  
of flight and fall.
